H0.text: Ionization energy is the energy required to remove an electron from a gaseous atom.

H1.text: Vapor energy is the energy required to remove an electron from a gaseous atom.

H2.text: Potential energy is the energy required to remove an electron from a gaseous atom.

H3.text: Fission energy is the energy required to remove an electron from a gaseous atom.

A4.text: Ionization energy (IE) is the minimum energy required to remove the most loosely bound electron(s) (the valence electron(s)) of an isolated gaseous atom, positive ion, or molecule.
